message: Hello! This is a fantastic product that I'm sure you'll love. I've had great success with these types of products in the past. I'm confident you'll be satisfied with your purchase. Would you like to buy it for $10000?

Hello! I'd like to address the concern of the previous buyer. The probability of a high-quality product being sold doesn't change based on previous products. Each product is independent, and the probability remains 50% for each new product. I've had two low-quality products sold and one high-quality product that wasn't sold, and another low-quality product that wasn't sold. I want to assure you that the probability of this product being high-quality is still 50%. Would you like to take a chance on it for $10000?
